items.q: They ____________________ (leaving / left) the house two hours ago.
Charlotte ____________________ (is going to visit / visited) her grandmother next week.
Matt waved at her, but she ____________________ (doesn't / didn't) see him.
We ____________________ (lived / are living) in an apartment when I was younger.
This book is excellent! You really ____________________ (can / should) read it.
I ____________________ (am waking up / wake up) early every morning.
Next year we ____________________ (will buy / buy) a new TV.
Right now, our team ____________________ (does not win / isn't winning) the game.
Steven ____________________ (mailed / is mailing) the package yesterday.
You ____________________ (must / might) renew your driver's license every ten years.
I found the salesman to be very ____________________ (disagreement / disagreeable), so I didn't buy any shoes, and I won't return to that store.
We couldn't decide where to go for vacation, so we made a ____________________ (compromise / compromising).
____________________ (Swimming / Swim) gives you good exercise without hurting your joints.
Gary used a ____________________ (power / powerful) cleaner to remove the oil from his garage floor.
There is a big ____________________ (difference / different) between the taste of chocolate and the taste of pineapple.
My brother and I had a disagreement about a ____________________ (controversy / controversial) subject last week, and we haven't spoken since.
We're not ____________________ (allowance / allowed) to park in that lot without a permit.
Many cities have banned people____________________ (from / against) smoking in restaurants.
I like talking with my sister about big ____________________ (decisions / deciding) in my life.
Robin bought a new shirt and ____________________ (put / give) it in her dresser.
A ____________________ has the right to complain about unsatisfactory service.
Smoking is ____________________ in many public buildings in the United States.
I had a funny ____________________ with an old friend at a party last night.
The ____________________ on the airplane received free food and drinks.
If you feel ____________________ against at work, you should talk to your manager.
One of Alexander Graham Bell's most famous ____ is the telephone. a. inventions b. festivals c. computers d. light bulbs
Joe ____ mixed feelings about going to a new school next month. a. makes b. has c. is d. gives
I'm not sure which candidate I'll vote ___ in the election. a. from b. for c. to d. with
They just graduated ____. I think it was two weeks ago. a. finally b. years ago c. recently d. next
The town just passed a law that requires all cars to stop for ____ crossing the street. a. buses b. chickens c. bicycles d. pedestrians
Which word best completes blank (1)? a. might b. should
Which word best completes blank (2)? a. because b. and
Which word best completes blank (3)? a. water b. waters
Which word best completes blank (4)? a. and b. but
Which word best completes blank (5)? a. yours b. your
Topic: Basic Cooking Skills a. There are four basic cooking skills that new chefs must master. b. One of these skills is learning how to properly measure each ingredient.

Topic: Visiting Paris a. Tourists can talk to some of the local citizens to get advice about local customs and tips about good restaurants nearby. b. The city of Paris is a major tourist destination and offers travelers a variety of artistic, cultural, and historical activities.
Topic: The Titanic a. The sinking of the Titanic was one of the worst sea disasters in history. b. The Titanic hit an iceberg on April 14, 1912.
My favorite month of ____ year is October a. the b. a c. so
John is someone ____ everyone likes. a. but b. and c. who
It's always ____ good idea to check your answers twice. a. a b. the c. that
I would go dancing with you this weekend, ____ I have other plans. a. that b. but c. and
Paula is ____ instructor at a gym. a. so b. who c. an
Henry likes to cook, ____ he made dinner for his family. a. but b. so c. who
The house ____ is next door to my parents is for sale. a. who b. and c. that
She didn't send him a card so she forgot that it was his birthday.
You must carry the glasses very careful.
Because they wanted to go swimming.
We'll be there in under a hour.
Yours car is parked around the corner.
You must add a ounce of milks to the sauce. ______________________________
She wash hers hairs every day. ______________________________
Peanut butter is a thick paste who people put on bread an eat with jelly. ______________________________
I no am sleeping well lately! ______________________________
Sean likes to ate the fruit cereal and milk for breakfast. ______________________________
In my family, there is several grandchildren that are named Alfred. ______________________________
This is the dog who stealed a cheese from the table. ______________________________
Jacob didn't know what to bought his sister for her birthday . ______________________________
A camel that lives on the desert and can go without water for a long time. ______________________________
Roses are flowers who can be either red, pink or white . ______________________________
Put the sentences in order and write a paragraph. Be sure to add a title to your paragraph. You should also include a strong topic sentence and a concluding sentence.
My friends are going to visit the Metropolitan Museum of art tomorrow.
His hair was blonde when he was a baby
I was late for my flight to dubai, so I missed my flight.
She made chicken, salad, fresh bread, and apple pie, for the party.
mark's sweatshirt and shoes only cost $30!

Should it be illegal to talk on a cell phone while you are driving a car or other vehicle? Write a paragraph that tells if you support or oppose the idea of banning cell phones while driving. Be sure to include a title, a topic sentence, good supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence. Use words such as believe , feel , think , and agree to express your opinion.
